3: Kamu...
Oh, good day, everyone!
Hello, my lovely Gray Ravens.
Seems like I'm the first here again.
Vera twirls a lock of her flowing red hair, scheming in delight.
A Strike Hawk member corrupted... I've been longing for such a fat piece of merit.
I'm not going to stand in your way.
I just need to ask Kamui some questions.
Whatever you do with him afterward, I won't have any objections.
Then please, help yourselves.
But allow me to remind you that, if you all dilly dally for too long and the other cleaners arrive... You know what I will do.
Kamui, when were you first corrupted?
It was... back when Roland...
Why didn't you tell us so?
Because... it's useless telling you...
So why are you running? Fear?
No... I just... decided to... remove the virus inside me...
We both know that there's no such method. Otherwise, we wouldn't have that many sacrifices...
I can't explain to you... because I'm not sure myself... It's nothing more than a gamble...
Kamui……
In view of our friendship, I can give you the opportunity to execute him.
After all, it's the same for me dead or alive.
Enough of your wickedness, Vera.
Lucia...
Ugh!
The past...
Mistakes must end here...
How pathetic...
(Why am I thinking of that...)
I believe in you, Kamui.
Take whatever opportunity you get...
Lucia sets down her blade.
Hmph, weakling... Guess I gotta do everything myself.
Hold on!
Do you want to stop my mission? Just to let you know, if you do, that'll be an act of treason.
No... I won't stop you. Rather, I demand you.
Huh?
Remember that 'free pass' you gave us?
Well, if you're really true to your word, I'd like to redeem it here.
How disappointing.
I thought you'd use it somewhere more interesting, like...
Forget it...
Hmph—! When I got up this morning, I wasn't expecting you to ruin my mood, Lee.
Vera turns around and stretches, as if relieved, and leaves without looking back.
But the powerful sound of high heels on the steel plate still vaguely reveals her extremely displeased mood.
By the way, it's just that I won't intervene in this matter.
Next time, you'd better count your blessings. Bye!
